text: anyone else find it alarming that Crashlytics automatically adds all organization members to a new app's team? I started tracking OMSI and it added someone from Nike to the team. Not sure we want all of our clients to know what new stuff we're working on...
Yikes.
There has to be ways to gate members, no?
Might be worth pinging them to see how they're handling that.
There's a groups feature in crashlytics that we should be using

text: Ha, we were talking about it the other day. Found a way to run those games on Mac without a browser.
They have Doom II and Lost Vikings.

text: <@U026PHQ3J> SIERRA GAMES! YES!
Sierra was basically the cadillac of dos games. Sad that none of the kings' quest series is up there. I have the fan remake of QFGII on my laptop and i fire it up from time to time
just wait until the fall
<http://www.sierra.com/kingsquest>
I was a young Space Quest fan. Can't wait to check out Dr. Brain. Thanks for the recommendations :simple_smile:
Yes! <http://Sarien.net|Sarien.net> was fun for a while
I have the roger wilco comics somewhere (I wanted to be Roger Wilco when I grew up at one point)
just some sort of space slacker
Liesure Suit Larry anyone?
that was Sierra too right?
Yep.
I never liked that series much, mainly cause i was too little to get the jokes
I used have some joky "coupons" from a space quest box still hanging around, will try to find them if I still have them.
Leisure Suit Larry was strictly OFF LIMITS after my parents saw me playing it one time.
My parents didn't allow it either...   had to play it at friends houses...
